intro: Phragmipedium besseae var. dalessandroi, commonly known as the Dalessandro’s phragmipedium, is a rare orchid species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its striking, large, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive yellow lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often with a waxy coating to retain moisture. This variety is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and limited natural distribution.
